data.title: Play choice: Wednesday, April 9

data.text:
Television choice

TO CATCH A THIEF

BBC One, 7pm

A new series in which a couple of reformed thieves explain what we can do to prevent burglary. It starts by showing how easy it is for experienced burglars to break into a home, and illustrates vividly the upset that it causes. Since the majority of burglaries are opportunistic and only one in five takes place at night, the programme is able to offer some very uncomplicated advice. Cut the hedge, get decent locks, don’t leave a spare key hidden in an obvious place, put up trelliswork and keep valuables out of sight. At least make it difficult for them.

HOLLYWOOD SCIENCE

BBC Two, 7.30pm

Ugh! In tonight’s programme Dr Jonathan Hare devises experiments to find
